raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Air bronchogram on chest x–ray", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Respiratory distress syndrome (RDS), also known as hyaline membrane disease (HMD), is characterized by surfactant deficiency and is most common in preterm infants. A classic radiological finding supporting RDS is the presence of air bronchograms on chest x-ray. The other options are either not supportive (term birth, onset after 6 hours) or are protective (antenatal corticosteroids).", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
